p: Ursane, oleanane, and lupine of Olibanum were identified to be responsible for the observed activity in many cases [ 57]. The pharmacological testing for the water extract in streptozocin-nicotinamide diabetic rats showed a hypoglycemic effect resembling that of glibenclamide and metformin. The effect is possibly due to the stimulation of insulin secretion from the remaining β-cells, the antioxidant activity, and the increase in serum insulin [ 58]. It is thought that B. carterii exhibited antidiabetic action through liver glycogen, the inhibition of degenerative changes in the β-cells of the pancreas in an alloxan diabetic model, and the suppression of apoptosis of peri-insular cells, and these effects were attributed to β-Boswellic acid derivatives [ 59, 60].
